It's illegal to carry out works that disturb birds during their nesting season. Never mind all the other wildlife, including Water Voles that will be disturbed 

Please sign & RT this petition asking @theroyalparks to delay "catching up on maintenance"

https://t.co/y4MGbVYjVc

These delightful little warblers are, for many, harbingers of Spring, arriving from West Africa for our Spring and Summer.

Listen out for them in woods & parks...

Water voles are Britain's fastest declining mammal, disappearing from 70% of known sites in only 7 years between national surveys in the late 1980s and early 1990s

It would be AMAZING to see them back in #Cornwall!

The extraordinary story of #Ukrainian folk artist, Kateryna Bilokur (1900-1961) who's deepest wish was to become painter. She succeeded against incredible odds.

Nell - a pencil sketch, by me.

Nell was our family's beautiful rough-haired lurcher. She lived to the ripe old age of 17 and was one of the best dogs ever! She was almost completely deaf and blind by the time she died, but was such a sunny soul ☀️ https://t.co/SrsKEZNBPt

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: You might also become aware of Hairy-footed Flower bees if you have an old stone, or cob, wall - as these are their preferred nesting habitats. Look out for lots of small ginger and/or black bees coming and going. Here's a male resting in an old stone wall... https://t.co/kta6AAswK9

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: Hairy-footed Flower #bees (Anthophora plumipes) will soon be out and about. The ginger coloured males emerge first, followed a week or so later by the all-black females. They have a penchant for lungwort, dwarf comfrey, red dead nettle & wallflowers, so keep your eyes peeled! https://t.co/OKASD9kiBn

description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: @BeachBonkersHQ Speaking to a GP was a huge hurdle for me too Kate. Having heard friends talk about ASD being 'trendy' I feared I might be labelled as someone trying to jump on a bandwagon. Also worried I might take precious NHS time away from others more needy than myself. So glad I went ahead

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: @marklangleyart I did loads of on-line tests and research before deciding to ask for an assessment, and finally made the decision because I truly believed it would be life changing to know for sure. If I could have afforded it I'd have gone private, but that was too expensive for me.

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: @marklangleyart I've become a master at reading emotions Mark. It's taken decades of practice but unless it's a new (to me) emotion, I usually get it right. Jokes, sarcasm, & snubs, I still don't get. One thing I've learned in the last few years is that no 2 people with Aspergers are the same

description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: @BrightsparkCre1 Gosh, now you're asking Kim! From what I understand the language has changed considerably over the years, but my diagnosis is what would previously have been known as 'Aspergers Syndrome'

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: @marklangleyart I went to my GP Mark, and he referred me to the NHS Adult Aspergers Assessment Unit. There's a huge waiting list for adults, but it has been worth the journey, and the wait. And like you say, I now feel reassured that I am fine.

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: @gillydormouse You sum it up perfectly Gill. I'm so sorry to know you have M.E/CFS... that must be hard to live with, but as you say, it helps if you can at least stop beating yourself up over not meeting your own expectations. Much love to you xxx

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: @KristenLindop It's been a bit of a rollercoaster, but my childhood, teens, and every decade since make sense now. The most difficult thing of all has been telling people about the diagnosis, because I've become so good at covering it up!

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: @KristenLindop I wish with all my heart I had known, or done something about it earlier. I was worried about taking up valuable resources, and that I wasn't deserving of the time it would take - but the process seems to filter you out at an early stage if a diagnosis appears unlikely...

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: @KristenLindop I ran out of coping strategies Kristen, so plucked up the courage to phone my GP. I explained it wasn't an emergency, but that it was one of the most important calls I'd ever made. He listened, asked some questions, and referred me to the Adult Aspergers Assessment Service...

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: @seasylvia2005 @MiltonBroome I wish someone had told me earlier, but of course that may not be the case for someone else.

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: @seasylvia2005 @MiltonBroome I can't tell you how much difference the diagnosis has made Sylvia. I also have a letter from the assessment team for employers - explaining what ASD is. I'm self employed so unlikely to use it, but I absolutely would if I were offered a job.

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: @CousinsCollette Thank you Collette 🌼

tweet: @mattsmith691 I find it strange that they call it a disorder too Matt. For me it is such a relief to know I am actually normal and not weird.

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: @Poverest_pedant @ChrisGPackham I have always beaten myself up for wanting to escape asap from gatherings and parties... especially as my husband is so sociable. It's so liberating to understand that this, and a multitude of other traits, are 'normal' for me. Also helpful for my husband.

name: Brigit Strawbridge

tweet: @Zararugosa Gosh, how wonderful for your daughter that she has a whole wonderful life ahead of her, knowing exactly who she is. I do hope your husband is able to make sense of not knowing sooner. That's the most challenging aspect for me - and for many others too, judging by this thread.

name: Brigit Strawbridge

name: Brigit Strawbridge

tweet: @RabbleChorus I think I'd probably have left it unexplored too, if I hadn't burned out a few years ago. I needed to find a way to understand what was going on, so I could deal with it and 'get back out there'. I'm glad it has also brought peace for your sister.

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: @mzdt I couldn't agree with you more about how important it is that such things are normalised Simon, and I also love the positive responses my post has prompted in others. The world, if you look beyond the madness we are bombarded with on social media, is full of kindness!

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻

Although it comes with regrets, and sadness that it wasn't picked up before I learned to cover it up, the diagnosis has ironically made me feel more normal than I have felt ever before.

name: Brigit Strawbridge

name: Brigit Strawbridge

name: Brigit Strawbridge

So it's all good and positive ☀️

name: Brigit Strawbridge

tweet:
Nothing to do with anything really, but last week I was diagnosed with #ASD (autistic spectrum disorder). As others will tell you, it's a relief to finally know for sure. Of course I'm sad I didn't know earlier, but suddenly my whole life makes sense. All 62 years of it.

1/2

Scarse bigger then a bumble bee

Wi hole beside as if a mouse
Had built the little barrel house 

 - John Clare

Lord Craigton (also opposing the Bill): "do we really need a Bill that legalises one of those dangers—disturbance by hounds—and attempts to prevent one other—killing by hounds? Use the word "attempts" deliberately."

And so it goes on. A lengthy but worthwhile read.

6/6

He continues... "What does one say to hounds in such circumstances? Let us face the implications of all this. There has been talk about scents; that they can follow yesterday's scent but not today's. How does one determine which is yesterday's scent and which is today's?"

5/6

description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: Either way, once the eggs hatch, the larvae munch their way through the pollen, or the caterpillars/grubs, before pupating. After pupating they stay in the nesting box till next year, then emerge as adult solitary wasps and solitary bees. Observational nest box from @N_Nature https://t.co/C217xRXqSh

tweet: Looking through photos from last yr & found these. Bee nesting boxes are mostly used by solitary bees, but the one on the left was used by a solitary wasp (above the cells). Bees always provision their larvae with pollen, but solitary wasps leave live prey.... https://t.co/aqcmAxSrPM

which he has summoned
    from the north—
         which he has taught
             to be mild, and silent—

thicken, and begin to fall
    into the world below
         like stars, or the feathers
               of some unimaginable bird

4/5

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet:
So, it's over.
    In the pine-crown
         he makes his nest,
             he's done all he can.

I don't know the name of this bird,
    I only imagine his glittering beak
         tucked in a white wing
             while the clouds—

he wants to go to sleep,
    but he's restless—
         he has an idea,
             and slowly it unfolds

from under his beating wings
    as long as he stays awake.
         But his big, round music, after all,
             is too breathy to last.

tweet:
White-Eyes
BY MARY OLIVER

In winter
    all the singing is in
         the tops of the trees
             where the wind-bird

with its white eyes
    shoves and pushes
         among the branches.
             Like any of us

1/5

John Clare

On the half-rotten ash-tree’s topmost twig,

Where a black quagmire quakes beneath the tread...

2/3

tweet:
Thaw 

Over the land freckled with snow half-thawed
The speculating rooks at their nests cawed
And saw from elm-tops, delicate as flowers of grass,
What we below could not see, Winter pass.

Edward Thomas 

(Painting 'Winter Thaw' - by Zoe Elizabeth Norman) https://t.co/WaTqDP7dE3

When weddings took place in the church, the village children used to tie the gate closed. The bride & groom had to throw us pennies so we'd open it for them. Happy times, but I never did try Babycham!

Photo from Yorkshire Post article

https://t.co/lrJr1lAwlM

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: This used to be my Granny's pub, in Patrick Brompton, near Bedale. We spent most of our holidays there in the 60's. I learned to play dominoes, and helped clean the tables in the mornings. I couldn't wait to be a 'grown up' so I could try the Babycham on the shelves in the bar... https://t.co/KA7FOgriYN

tweet:
Our beautiful and once common Greenfinches have, this week, been added to the UK Red List. Of course there are other factors at play, but the least we can do to help is keep our bird feeders clean.

Advice on good hygiene practice here, from @_BTO 

https://t.co/ELgy4ngEmO

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet:
To anyone who feeds #birds

These finches may look cute & fluffy, but swollen throats and gullets are a sign of Trichomoniasis, a horrible disease transmitted through direct contact, often via unclean bird feeders, tables & baths. As it progresses they will be unable to swallow. https://t.co/Vn1lBTz5jv

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet:
The Dipper 
BY KATHLEEN JAMIE

It was winter, near freezing,
I'd walked through a forest of firs
when I saw issue out of the waterfall
a solitary bird.

It lit on a damp rock,
and, as water swept stupidly on,
wrung from its own throat
supple, undammable song.

1/2 https://t.co/7rJbCZ2p7v

tweet: Following this, I walked further downstream and watched the Dipper pair for nearly an hour - preening, dipping, bobbing, and diving. I think they must roost in the same place they nest, because I almost always find them together at this site just before dusk. I love them! 🤎

description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet:
Our wild kin cannot speak, or vote, so it's up to us to speak and vote on their behalf.

This... @sheryllmurray & all other MPs who voted to allow the continuation of sewage being dumped in our waterways... is why folk are so upset about you voting against the amendment.

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet:
Here's another short video of 2 baby Dippers from the adults' second brood, the day they fledged. 

I love them - and when you love something, you naturally want to everything you can protect it. Human nature. https://t.co/FmBTxg7PeF

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet:
My biggest fear is that our local stream will become #polluted, so Dippers will no longer be able to live & feed there.

I've already noticed another nearby stream is always a milky grey colour - agricultural run-off perhaps? I don't know. But I'm going to try and find out.

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet:
My favourite thing this year has been getting to know the Dippers who live & breed in the fast flowing stream running through our village. Our local #rivers & streams are clean enough to support #wildlife.  

Many others are not.

Here's a short video of the male preening... https://t.co/LXXjzjLJ2Z

But yesterday you surpassed yourself.
Painted a canopy of stars. 
Sparkled in the early morning sun.
Frosted your silken hair.

And I fell in love with you.

As you did your thing.

3/3

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet:
My walks are transformed.
As, clothing the naked branches,
You do your thing.

I notice you now, always, on my travels
And my heart fills with joy
Whenever and wherever you are 
Doing your thing

2/3

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet:
Old Man's Beard (Traveller's Joy)

I never much noticed you before.
Up there in the tree tops.
Doing your thing.

But I see you now.
Climbing, creeping, cascading
Seamlessly stitching. Bewitching.
As you do your thing.

1/3

description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet:
But a few others—I’ve seen them walking down
the beach holding a few stones, and they
look at them rather more closely now.
Once in a while, I swear, I’ve even heard
one or two of them saying “Hello.”
Which, I think, does no harm to anyone or
anything, does it?

3/4

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet:
This doesn’t mean we ever have a conversation, 
or that they have the kind of feelings we do, 
yet it might mean something. Whatever the stones are, 
they don’t lie in the water and do nothing.

Some of my friends refuse to believe it
happens, even though they’ve seen it...

2/4

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet:
WATERING THE STONES - Mary Oliver

Every summer I gather a few stones from
the beach and keep them in a glass bowl.
Now and again I cover them with water,
and they drink. There’s no question about
this; I put tinfoil over the bowl, tightly,
yet the water disappears.

1/4 https://t.co/BZNE1gxXOj

tweet:
I interviewed the warden & asked how many nesting birds there were on the Inner Island that year. 
Amongst others there were: 1500 Sandwich Terns, 1200 Arctic Terns, 100 Common Terns, but only 5 RoseateI Terns (down from100 the previous year)
I wonder what the numbers are today.. https://t.co/i6AUxW2Mh0

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: Thank you to everyone who speaks out... following your hearts, taking the flack, and making a difference. You inspire me (and many others, I'm sure), to take action and raise my game 💚

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: We are all motivated in different ways. For me, it's impossible not to want to help the creatures I love. So, thought I'd love my twitter feed to be filled with beautiful images of wildlife, I am deeply grateful to those people I follow who pull no punches, and tell it as it is.

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: Knowledge, however uncomfortable, empowers & motivates us to make change. Signing petitions & writing to MPs helps raise awareness; boycotting makes a statement; researching the provenance of what you consume, and switching to make sure someone else isn't paying the price, helps.

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: It would be easy to 'switch off' and mute the accounts of those who so bravely stick their heads above the parapet and speak for animals, trees, humans, who have no voice themselves. But then I wouldn't know what's going on, and ignorance is the same as turning a blind eye...

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: Sometimes I open Twitter and don't know how to absorb what I see. I've felt utterly choked this week about the slaughtered dolphins in the Faroe Islands, logging in the heart of the Amazon Rainforest, and so many other atrocities caused by human hands...

description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet:
Yesterday I met a retired couple who showed me around their little orchard. The trees were covered, and I mean COVERED, in newly emerged Red Admiral butterflies! 
Why so many? 
Simple. 
Because nettles had been left for the caterpillars to feed and thrive on.

tweet: @DRnaturegirl Hi Debbie. These are Osmia bicornis (Red Mason bees) and the remaining cocoons look fine. Best thing your friend can do is put the cover back on, and pop them inside a shed or outhouse for the winter. They need to stay cool and dry. Then hang up outside again next spring...

Crab spiders (sometimes known as Flower spiders) lurk on flowers waiting for unsuspecting insects to land, trap them in their front legs... then feed on them.

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: One of my most vivid childhood memories is stopping beside a stream in the New Forest for a picnic, in the early 60's. I can picture the water vividly - sparkling, cold, crystal clear, and full of minnows. I don't remember the last time I saw a minnow...

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: I know little about the ecology of rivers & streams, but having spent so much time sitting by them in recent months, it is obvious how fragile they are, and how much the wild creatures and plants living in/around them depend on the water remaining free from #pollution.

name: Brigit Strawbridge
description: Love this planet. Sad about the harm we cause. Tweets about wild places, wild life, wild plants & Art. Autistic. Patron of @godsacre https://t.co/i5vzHbFjeP 🌻
tweet: Given the shocking state of many UK rivers and streams, I feel more blessed than ever that the little stream running through our village is so alive and 'clean' - that it provides the Dippers I've watched throughout this summer with all the food they need to rear their young. https://t.co/iyEiDfsA2b
